metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8610 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
A denial of service flaw was found in OpenSSL 0.9.8, 1.0.1, 1.0.2 through1.0.2h, and 1.1.0 in the way the TLS/SSL protocol defined processing ofALERT packets during a connection handshake. A remote attacker could usethis flaw to make a TLS/SSL server consume an excessive amount of CPU andfail to accept connections from other clients.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8610` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.22
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.22
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

gnutls-bin - 3.0.11+really2.12.23-12ubuntu2.6
libgnutls-openssl27 - 2.12.23-12ubuntu2.6
libgnutls26 - 2.12.23-12ubuntu2.6
libgnutlsxx27 - 2.12.23-12ubuntu2.6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.22').
openssl098: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
gnutls26 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.12.23-12ubuntu2.6').
gnutls26 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.12.23-12ubuntu2.6').
gnutls28: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
